column1: ... = data not available; | = marks break in series; – = magnitude equals zero; 0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate, budget figure; $ = United States dollars;  NZ$ = New Zealand dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income;  IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour.

column2: For 2001, 2006, 2011, and 2016, population data are based on census data. For all other years, data are based on estimates of vital events of births and deaths plus net migration.
Covers all wage and salary earners from all islands.
For 2000–2005, taxes on products are distributed among the GDP components. For 2006 onward, taxes on products are measured separately from GDP components.
Refers to fruits and vegetables; meat, poultry, and fish; cereal products;  soft drink and sweets; farm products, fats, and oils; other food; and prepared food.
Refers to tobacco and alcoholic beverages.
Refers to clothing, clothing materials, and footwear.
Refers to rent and mortgages, house insurance, and house maintenance.
Refers to fuel and lighting, household appliances, furniture, home furnishings, cleaning supplies, household supplies, and household services.
Refers to internal travel, overseas travel, motor vehicles, motor fuel and oil, and motor vehicle expenses.
Refers to other goods and services.
Follows the IMF's Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014.
Follows the IMF's Balance of Payments Manual (sixth edition).

Figures were originally expressed in New Zealand dollars and were converted to United States dollars by applying the average exchange rate for the period. The significant decrease in the 2006 level was due to the settlement of the Italian loan held by Servizi Assicurativi del Commercio Estero (ex Express Cook Islands Agents Limited guarantee liability), offset in part by adverse exchange rate movements over the first 6 months of 2006.
Refers to debt service as a percentage of total exports as reflected under "Direction of Trade".
